WRITING.TEXT: I came to reddit to post about the same thing, and yours first showed up. This makes me feel less alone in my struggles, as I am also young and not much of a drinker, yet lately it's been getting bad. It could be that maybe subconsciously you've been exposed to drinking as a regular coping mechanism, which it isn't, so that is the first thing your mind wanders to when in need of wanting to escape... Know that you are not alone in this and that being self aware is the best thing and you can take steps to make sure you don't fall into the same unhealthy habits that others in your family have made. Love and Light.

WRITING.TITLE: The warning signs.
WRITING.TEXT: My whole life I told myself I'd never be sucked into the faux glamour of alcohol. Three of my family members have died because of alcohol or health issues related to alcohol abuse. A few more are having major issues, including my grandma. Anyway. The past 5 months have started going downhill for me, internally at least. I can keep myself together during the day, smile in front of friends and tell my family I'm doing well, but at the end of the day I typically feel so empty and need a drink to fill it. I'm such a lightweight that it doesn't take much. I try not to drink more than a beer or two, or a mixed drink. But when I do consume more, I feel like I'm more relaxed and more easygoing, but I'm also more impulsive and loud. I've been starting fights with my partner, over stupid, petty things that I can't say sober, or coming home drunk and thinking I'm okay to drive when in reality I'm probably not. And that's scary. My partner gets worried that I won't come back home one of these nights, and that worry is expressed as fear, so they raise their voice, and I end up raising mine. Nobody wins and everyone is a little more heartbroken than before. To make things worse, I work at a bar that is very lenient and I have customers that will just buy everyone a drink on slow nights. So it seems socially acceptable for a young person to drink, no big deal. However it's been going on almost every night since I turned 22. I've become a mild alcoholic, in a sense. I hate this part of me. I hate that my whole family is addicted to this poison and I don't want to fall down the same rabbit hole. I know what it does to people, and I don't want to keep causing (needless) drama and chaos and harm. I feel like I'm becoming disrespectful to myself in a way, as I'm self aware but don't try to stop much. I go a few days sober and then fall back down again. I'm starting therapy next week so maybe I can have someone to talk to and process everything in a healthy manner. Maybe I can learn to communicate more adequately instead of just yelling at my partner. It's hard. I don't feel like I have anyone to really talk to, I'm alone in a new city, and I keep so much inside. Nobody knows how much I hurt, not even my partner. TLTR: Catching signs of alcohol abuse/realizing I'm self medicating.

WRITING.TITLE: I think I love my boyfriend more than my girlfriend...
WRITING.TEXT: Hey y'all. 20-something year old female, who has had open relationships in the past, now found myself in a relationship dynamic I don't think is healthy for any party involved. I met my girlfriend years ago in a chat group for those with similar interests, and we have been friends...until about 3 days ago when she asked me to be her girlfriend. I ended an unhealthy relationship at the beginning of the year, did a bunch of traveling, all the while trying to make friends outside of my ex's group. I ended up meeting "Allen", a beautiful soul who has shown me so much in the short amount of time we have known one another. We met through a mutual friend last October (who I guess was dating him at the time). I figured we'd keep things chill and friendly especially if we both were in relationships and busy travelling. Fast forward. Me and my boy don't work out, and Allen has tried a couple of casual gfs, who all eventually move on or he dumps. We're still friends but we acknowledge an attraction--mental, physical, emotional. And it's unlike anything I have experienced. We have a real connection. I explain to Allen that I typically like girls so it's rare for me to be exclusive with a man. He understands. However, my "girlfriend" has become heightenedly obsessed and infatuated with me. She has a husband and a child, mind you, and is states away. I figured we would keep being friends and try out for a girlfriend/girlfriend scenario. I thought I liked her as much as she liked me but boy was I wrong. I feel guilty now, like I only want to love people because they love me, and I don't wanna make them feel bad. I liked my gf until a few days ago when she pushed to make it official because me and Allen made our situation more official. Now gf stalks me and my bf, is constantly talking to him about me and her obsession and jealousy of him. He mentioned it today and it has gotten way out of hand. He is not poly, but wants me to be happy if I like someone. I have so much guilt and regret for giving into someone's desires for me when I wasn't 100% into it. TDLR: I got a new bf, my female friend pushed for a relationship and I gave it a chance, now she is going overboard with messaging and obsessing over both of us when she has a husband and son to look after. Bf is concerned for me and thinks she isn't heathy. I don't think so either. I don't have the heart to break up after 3 days. UPDATE: After much contemplation and reading through your guy's responses (which are greatly appreciated), I reached out to her to discuss my boundaries and that I wanted to take things slow. She was posting these long long posts about how infatuated she was with me. I explained to her I am not all I seem, "as beautiful as I am, I can be equally as ugly", and not to put me on a pedestal... and that really upset her; she got mad that I was "being manipulative" just by giving her a heads up that her actions were making me anxious. She got upset that I have my boyfriend, I respectfully asked her to tone it down (she had been spamming him with messages, told him her whole life story in a day, and I have known her for years and am aware of her mental illnesses) and of course, accused me of playing with her feelings, which was not my intention at all. At least it was a few days that we "dated", not a whole year that I "led her on". The thing is, I truly liked and love her, but her intense reactions and mood swings really caught me off guard. She got really harsh and aggressive real quickly; I had to block her because she kept texting me and emailing me and messaging me about how awful I am. I literally just asked her to calm down, take a step back and evaluate the reality of the situation, especially since I could not physically be near her... She only seemed to take, my energy and counsel, and my boyfriend pointed that out. Hours of one sided conversations have been the basis of our friendship, anyway. Sigh. I guess I can't always make people happy and I have learned from this situation. Update pt 2: I called it off and broke up. Of course she feels I chose Allen over her, and I feel bad, but I would feel even worse if this dynamic had continued..
I am so scared of hurting her. I know she suffers from mental illness and I don't want to be responsible for her. I don't know.

I have talked with her in the past when she wanted to pursue a relationship, and I wasn't ready. She got really upset and confused with me, as we had been talking. I like her and love her, but I feel like I can only focus on one relstionship right now, and frankly, I have let her know she comes off too strong at times. I get it... So do I. It's just I have never seen this jealous side of her or this extreme manic side until I told her about my new bf, then she immediately was asking to make me her gf. I figured, "let's try, you've been pursuing me for quite some time, I care for you and want to see you happy." Now I am uncomfortable, mostly with her massaging my bf constantly because he is a busy guy, and cannot always respond. She is an agoraphobic, stay-at-home mom and gets upset if I don't even message or call her back right away. I do my best to be compassionate. I suppose I need to reinstate some solid boundaries so we are all on the same page...

Yeah... Planning on having a talk today. She has made this huge social media posts about us, about me. Lol and 3 days later, here I am, breaking up with her...the world can see it... This is why I always try to keep my personal relationships PERSONAL for a reason. I guess I am selfish either way.

WRITING.TITLE: I (F24) am considering moving out of the state, without my SO (M29) because he won't get a job.
WRITING.TEXT: Hello. I guess I will start off by saying I have been looking through online sources, as well as this subreddit, to find some kind of advice or closure for my situation. My situation is very unique, and I cannot seem to find any one resource to give me advice, and I am trying to put the pieces together. My Significant Other and I live in a large city, both far away from family. We had planned to move out of state to live with my mother and grandmother--however, my grandmother passed away last month while we visited to take care of her. This was supposed to help slowly transition to moving, as our lease ended at the end of March. Because of my grandmother's death, my mother no longer wanted us to really stay, nor did we have jobs lined up (as I was supposed to be my grandmothers caregiver, full-time.) We have been having problems with having stable income, so I have been working longer shifts to compensate for it. He had lost his job prior to the death of my grandmother, so he stopped working before our plans fell through (more on this later). This brings me to the "unique-ness" of our situation: I am a professional dancer/entertainer at a night club, and he makes artwork on the side. I have been very supportive of him trying to make his art into an actual company, and I support his dreams. I invest in supplies for him, even though we don't have much, and I do my best to encourage him while we try to get back on our feet. One big that has been emotionally and physically draining is that he has not tried to get a job since losing his previous one. His art right now is not bringing in as much income as it would if he had another source of income (a.k.a. a job). The thing is, he does NOT want to work. He does NOT want to try to find a job. He just assumes every one is going to deny him. I am starting to notice patterns of laziness, and it might stem from depression and housing with a roommate who is not particularly clean nor organized, but then again, he has been showing signs since 4 months ago. He was always late to work, would never cover people's shifts even though they always covered him, and he would complain and say it was not worth the commute (which in hindsight, it was not, but he very well could have been looking for another closer job). He ended up getting fired when I went to go visit my grandma early March, before she passed. He was to fly in days later to help me out with grandma, and we would fly back to our city together. But while I was out of state, we agreed he'd work more shifts and try to make some extra money since I would be gone. He pretty much just slept through his alarm and all the phone calls from me and his previous manager. As for me and my job, it causes so many issues. I make pretty decent money, but not enough to keep us afloat. I used to be a "model" and "cam girl" of sorts before dating him, and that was some more passive income on top of my dancing. Since getting more serious into our relationship (we are 8 months in), I have had to quit my internet work and modeling, which not only has taken a toll on my wallet, but also my self esteem. I have had to cut off friendships with other sex workers because he feels like they influence me or he gets jealous because I have connection to certain friends. I feel like a possession and that I am not worthy, if that makes any sense... I don't work that often. I used to work 30-35 hours a week, be solid, but now it's barely 20 hours. Maybe 15 hours, if that. Every night I come home, it just turns into a big argument and he talks down to me about my job. Then he compares the fact that I make more money than him and I sometimes hold it over his head... It doesn't help that he drinks often, which is another issues altogether, but it definitely fuels his resentment towards me and my job that I have had since before meeting him. Dancing has been very convenient in terms of a flexible schedule, and I like to travel, and have been traveling more since I had to attend my grandmothers funeral, out of state. I also have some re-occurring injuries and back pains, so it helps when I can take time off and give myself some care. I have been looking for a steady day time job to slowly transition out of dancing, but I am also trying to finish my Associates degree this year. I really need the money to get through school. My SO has no interest in trying to go back to school, but says he supports me. If he truly supported me, he would understand that my job is just a job, not any reason to go behind his back, or "cheat" on his, as he often says. I am so tired of trying to defend myself and my work, just to be talked down on and feel unappreciated and shamed. I don't tell anyone about this. I can't. Recently, as of this past week, my mother invited us to live with her. She has been having issues coping with loneliness and grieving, and she wanted some help with rent. I am still down to move out of state and start fresh, to heal any animosity between my mother and I. I want be closer to family, but my SO doesn't like my mother since she changed plans on us after the funeral. He doesn't trust her. She kind of screwed us over, since we had planned for 5 months to move in with her and my grandma, and our lease ended at the end of March when we got back from out of state. So now we are staying with a friend, trying to get back on our feet, with just me working. But I feel like I am at the end of my rope, and I am completely open to living with my mother, even if it is just for a few months. I kind of just want to go, and I don't really care right now if he comes with me. I am feeling smothered, dragged down, and used. I don't know what to do. #8203; Side note: Does anyone know of any support subreddits or forums for SWs or dancers ("strippers")? I think it would help a lot to connect with others maybe experiencing similar things. Sorry if this is all too long, I hope I communicated my situation adequately. **TL;DR: My SO and I are having issues surrounding my job as a club dancer, but he does not have a job nor has tried to get one. I am actively looking for new work, he is not, although he makes and sells art occasionally. We have an opportunity to move in with my mother and start fresh, but he doesn't want to go due to previous issues with potential living situations with my mother. I think I should be closer to family and start fresh and get back on my feet and finish school. I need a second opinion/advice, thank you.**
Thank you for the resources! I consider myself a Sex worker, just different from a full service worker. So these subreddits are helpful.
If I don't work, we won't be able to save up money to get where we need to be in life...

I'm no doctor in any sense... but just from experience, it has helped my depression and my mild psychosis episodes. Some states have clinical trials for ketamine treatments and I am trying to get into one. Just be safe and hopefully you can find a clinic that will help you.

Are we the same person? Lol. All joking aside, I can definitely relate and empathize with your current situation. I have two names that trigger me, and I immediately lose my cool after hearing them or even meeting someone with the same name. I have had some time to cope with the trauma associated with the names, and it does get easier with time. Although my trigger names are not someone currently in my life, I am in a similar situation and do find it extremely hard to have someone still in my partner's life who had once been romantically involved with him. Even if they don't talk every day, it is still painful to know that they are in each other's lives, regardless of your feelings. It really sucks, but please please do not hurt yourself over this situation. Comparing yourself to another person will only dig you deeper, and even if you don't believe it right now, you ARE worthy of love and respect, especially from yourself. No one else is better than you. You do not have to have this girl in your life or even be friends with her.
